alert.note: Alert for Somerset (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 08 at 1:48PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Scattered strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Somerset County through 300 PM EDT... At 147 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking scattered strong thunderstorms near Westover, or 7 miles southwest of Princess Anne, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Reduced visibility and minor flooding possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Westover around 210 PM EDT. Princess Anne around 235 PM EDT. University Of Maryland Eastern Shore around 240 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Oriole, Byrdtown, Cokesbury, Fairmount, Upper Hill, Hopewell, Eden, Kingston, Dames Quarter and Widgeon. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Be prepared for rapid changes in weather and road conditions. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
